Sgurr Choinnich Mor

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

A fine pyramidal peak, Sgurr Choinnich Mor is the westernmost of the Grey Corries; its fine arete requires a long approach from any direction.

 You have not climbed Sgurr Choinnich Mor.

Region: Fort William

Altitude: 1094 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.75/5
Rating: 3.8/5 (48 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

The Grey Corries ridge

Other routes and challenges

An alternative approach is from the head of Glen Nevis, past Steall Falls. Head up the glen for several kilometres before striking off to make the ascent of Sgurr Choinnich Beag, continuing along the ridge to reach the parent peak.

The epic challenge is the Lochaber Traverse which continues from the Grey Corries route above onto the Aonachs and eventually Ben Nevis - though the ground leading from the Sgurr Choinnich Beag bealach up to Stob Coire Bhealaich is very tricky.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Fort William Hotels

Fort William B&B

Fort William Cottages

Lochaber Hostels
